meanings.definition: To give as a gift or honor.
meanings.sent1: She will bestow a beautiful necklace on her best friend.
meanings.sent2: The king decided to bestow a medal upon the brave soldier.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought it would bestow a dead mouse as a gift to its owner.
meanings.sent4: The sun bestows its warm rays upon the earth each morning.
meanings.sent5: The magician's wand seemed to bestow magical powers upon the young girl.

meanings.sent1: The teacher will bestow awards on the students at the end of the year.
meanings.sent2: The mayor will bestow the key to the city upon the visiting dignitary.
meanings.sent3: The clown decided to bestow a rubber chicken as a prize for the game.
meanings.sent4: The moon bestows its gentle light upon the sleeping town.
meanings.sent5: The fairy godmother bestows blessings upon the newborn princess.

meanings.sent1: The company will bestow scholarships to deserving students.
meanings.sent2: The genie will bestow three wishes upon the lucky person who frees him.
meanings.sent3: The tree decided to bestow its ripe fruits upon the hungry animals.
meanings.sent4: The river bestows its life-giving waters to the parched land.
meanings.sent5: The wizard bestows his knowledge upon the young apprentice.
